intro: Gaillonia inopinata, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, orange-red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It has a dense, evergreen canopy and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its invasive nature, it is considered a problematic species in many areas where it has been introduced.
